name: Commando Jack
description: A Tower Defence game, that actually allows you to sit inside the turret and come face-to-face with the enemies! Addictive strategy - action game, with loads of shooting and explosions! Nearing 2 MILLION DOWNLOADS!
minimum_requirements: Processor: Less than 6 years old DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 133 MB available space
recommended_requirements: Processor: Less than 3 years old Storage: 133 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Commando Jack  seems like yet another pointless mobile port that not only adds nothing new, but doesn't even make an effort to adjust its systems to the PC platform.

This game is fun but i don't think it belongs to pc platform,if Developers wanted to do that,they should add some graphic and character updates.Also new weapons are necessary.  If you have kid or little brother/sister this is not bad game to give them. :D   1 Point for the first person weapon 1 Point for the music and map customization 1 Point to die of aliens  ---3/10---

very cheap-feeling tower-defense game where the main gimmick is being able to go into first-person mode and shoot waves manually. it's actually kind of a pain to do so, especially since there's no real visual feedback when your shots hit. indeed, the visuals in general are uninspiring, and they haven't even bothered to remove the parts of the game like GET FREE COINS buttons which clearly show it's just a rushed port of a mobile game.   i don't even remember how this ended up in my games list so i'm gonna just assume it was part of a giveaway. it still isn't worth it for free.
Tower Defense with kinda old school graphics. Personally i don't like games with BS graphics. Price is too high for game like this but i can't complain - I got this for free. 4/10.

It's a fun little mobile game that can entertain you for some time, yet that time is too short. Considering I got it for free of course, but if you are getting it for 10 euros, or even on sale, let's say 3 euros, it's simply not worth it. You can analyze it was ported straight over from mobile to pc, no improvements/modifications to the UI or whatsoever. Cannot recommend it, for the price, for it's poor mechanics and for the non-existent effort to adapt the game to a new and different plataform.
I got this game for free, and I can honestly say it was worth the price.

Actually Commando Jack is a great game, i have fun before i got the crash (Last Part) I dont know whats going on, i play like normal. But after I play like Level 7 or 8, the game got crashed. Got this for free so whatever, but i would never reccommend this game for $10. Mabey if it was like $1 i would.
Decent TD game that didn't really live up to my expectations. The graphics are pretty bad and the gameplay is repetitive, but overall it's decent.
Kinda fun TD, pretty basic but fun. It is however a mobile game thats a bit badly ported for PC. full price? naaah not worth it. but Its pretty ok if you get it on sale for like 0.99

This is a very poor quality tower defense game with a number of dealbreaking issues.  Resolution is capped and cannot be changed - the game looks ugly even on a 1080p display.  The game relies on simple tower defense mechanisms, but also a 'first person' mode where you control a gun that you can use to shoot any enemies that get by. The problem is they don't allow mouse aim - you have to use WASD to try point the gun! Incredible incompetence in UI design.   Obvious thumbs down. Plenty of other tower defense games to choose from.

If you like paying for games that aren't even better then one you could find on the internet then go ahead buy this game but if you want to put money on a quality game like i dunno half life or somethin' but for heavens sake... DO NOT BUY THIS GAME ITS SHOCKING (luckily though i got it from some cheap giveaway)

This is a fairly bland tower defense like any other tower defense. You can go into first-person mode and shoot some aliens yourself, but the core gameplay is still pretty familiar. So what it really comes down to is execution. And, well...it's a mobile port. It's VERY CONSPICUOUSLY a mobile port. The interface is clearly designed for a touch screen. There are no keyboard shortcuts and no way to change the controls. It runs in a fixed fullscreen resolution, so if you want to go into windowed mode or adjust it to fit your monitor better...sorry, there's no option for that.  To top it all off, it's priced at $10, which is quite frankly an unreasonable price point for a port so lacking in polish. There are tower defense games out there that are just as good or better that you can play totally free.  Look, I like the tower defense genre, but you can do a lot better than this game. Do not recommend.
